page.title: 01Introduction to Grundisburgh
page.content: Grundisburgh is a village approximat- ely 5 kms from town of Woodbridge,10 kms from Ipswich. The main street of the village follows the valley line of the R.Finn as it descends a gentle hill. Connurbations occur at the top and the bottom of this hill, though there is ribbon development along its length. Land not used for housing is mostly used for agricultural purposes; arable and stock. There is also some woodland maintained largely for game. The rural environment is without manu- facturing industry, retaining peace and unspoilt charm, though influenced by centres of industry nearby; many of the population working outwith the village. A "Key" village in the Suffolk Plan,further expansion may take place providing housing though little employ- ment.There's an expressed concern that new housing be provided with sympathy.
